channel.title: Geting free sky box office with a 9 volt battery
channel.description:
what u need: a sky box + 9volt battery + the little phone connecter on the sky box
go on2 a chanel with box office
when it says it needs to dial up or whatever attach a 9 volt battery to the 2 pins when it disconects take off the battery
then u get a free film
NOTICE havnt tryed for a month still should work

item.title: Geting free sky box office with a 9 volt battery

item.description:

my dad took one apart because the card insert broke. There was just a little memory storage device for settings and logs etc… so i imagine that the logs for the Sky Box Office Will Connect There

item.title: Geting free sky box office with a 9 volt battery
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“nix, post:8, topic:56666”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=80493.msg888424#msg888424 date=1171221600]
You left out a very important point - if you ever plug your digibox back in after doing this, you will be charged for everything you bought while it was unplugged. I have no idea if cutting the power causes it to lose this record of what you bought, but the safest bet is just never to plug it back in (there’s no need to really).
[/quote]

ive got a feeling its stored in the box[/quote]

I’m pretty sure the digibox keeps a record of what you bought, and so do the servers at sky. If they don’t tally up, ie your box says you bought more than the sky servers do, they bill you for the extra stuff (and possibly, if it happened a lot, bitch at you for cheating the system).

What I meant was, I don’t think the Digiboxes have much in the way of permanent storage, so it might be possibly to wipe this record just by unplugging it for a while - but it’s easier just never to put the phone line back in.

Read full topic
item.source: Geting free sky box office with a 9 volt battery
